Kepala Puskesmas Kubutambahan II Klarifikasi Temuan Obat Kadaluwarsa
06 Nov 2019, 08:40 by Siti Nurseha


Kepala Puskesmas Kubutambahan II Klarifikasi Temuan Obat Kadaluwarsa

KBRN, Singaraja : Kepala Puskesmas Kubutambahan II, dr. Asty Sanitha Dewi, Selasa (5/11/2019) memberikan keterangan terkait penemuan obat kadaluwarsa di Puskesmas setempat. dr Asty sekaligus mengklarifikasi hasil sidak Komisi IV DPRD Buleleng yang menimbulkan kesan bahwa puskesmas kubutambahan dua menyalurkan obat kadaluwarsa.
Terkait ditemukannya obat kedaluwarsa di Puskesmas Kubutambahan II yang terletak di Desa Tamblang, Kecamatan Kubutambahan, Ia menjelaskan sebenarnya obat itu tidak disebarkan kembali pasien, melainkan ditaruh di gudang. Namun memang, ruangan gudang obat berdekatan dengan ruangan instalasi farmasi.
Asty menjelaskan ruangan gudang obat memang menjadi satu dengan ruangan instalasi farmasi. Namun, antara gudang obat dengan instalasi farmasi sudah ada sekat pembatas. Sekat pembatas itu berupa pintu kaca. Sehingga kesannya gudang obat dan instalasi farmasi menjadi satu ruangan padahal itu dua tempat yang berbeda fungsi.
“Instalasi farmasi dan gudang obat sebenarnya lain dengan sekat namun masih dalam satu  gedung atau ruangan,” jelasnya.
Menurutnya, memang ada obat kedaluwarsa namun di gudang obat bukan di instalasi farmasi. Obat-obat yang kedaluwarsa tersebut akan dikembalikan ke Depo Farmasi dinas Kesehatan Kabupaten Buleleng. Ada beberapa obat kedaluwarsa di dalam kardus yang ditemukan dan obat tersebut tidak diberikan lagi kepada pasien. Untuk obat-obatan itu sebenarnya akan dikembalikan ke Depo Farmasi dan pihak Puskesmas Kubutambahan II rutin melakukan stok opname yang memiliki jangka waktu kedaluwarsa sudah dekat.
“Ataupun yang sudah lewat masa kedaluwarsanya agar dikembalikan ke Depo Farmasi untuk dimusnahkan,” ujar Asty.
Asty pun mengungkap Standar Operasional Prosedur (SOP) untuk stok opname obat-obatan yang dilakukan. Stok opname dilakukan sebelum akhir bulan. Seluruh obat-obatan dicek apakah ada yang sudah kedaluwarsa ataupun mendekati kedaluwarsa. Seperti obat yang yang kedaluwarsa awal November dilakukan stok opname pada akhir Oktober. Pada akhir Oktober sudah dikemas dan bersiap untuk dikembalikan ke Depo Farmasi.
“Akhir bulan dilakukan stok opname, jadwal pengembalian ke Depo awal bulan. Pada intinya, obat kedaluwarsa yang ditemukan itu akan dikembalikan ke Depo, bukan untuk disebar lagi ke pasien,” pungkasnya.

Head of Kubutambah Health Center II Clarification of Expired Medicine Findings
Nov 6 2019, 08:40 by Siti Nurseha


Head of Kubutambah Health Center II Clarification of Expired Medicine Findings

KBRN, Singaraja: Head of Kubutambah II Health Center, dr. Asty Sanitha Dewi, Tuesday (11/5/2019) gave information related to the discovery of expired drugs at the local health center. Dr. Asty also clarified the results of the sudden inspection of Commission IV of the DPRD in Buleleng, which gave the impression that the two additional health centers were distributing expired drugs.
Related to the discovery of expired drugs in Kubutambah II Health Center located in the village of Tamblang, District of Kubut adds, he explained that the drug was not actually distributed again by the patient, but was placed in a warehouse. But indeed, the drug storage room is adjacent to the pharmaceutical installation room.
Asty explained that the medicine warehouse room had become one with the pharmaceutical installation room. However, there is already a barrier between the drug warehouse and pharmaceutical installations. The partition divider is in the form of a glass door. So it seems that the drug warehouse and pharmaceutical installation become one room even though it has two different functions.
"Pharmacy installations and drug warehouses are actually different from the bulkhead but still in one building or room," he explained.
According to him, there is indeed an expired drug but in the drug warehouse not in a pharmaceutical installation. The expired drugs will be returned to the Pharmacy Depo of Buleleng Regency Health Office. There are a number of expired drugs in the box that have been found and they are no longer given to patients. For these drugs, they will actually be returned to the Pharmacy Depot and the Kubutambah II Health Center routinely conducts an in-stock inventory that has an expiry period.
"Or those who have passed their expiry date to be returned to the Pharmacy Depot to be destroyed," said Asty.
Asty also revealed Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for taking stock of drugs taken. Stock taking is done before the end of the month. All medicines are checked for expiration or nearing expiration. Like drugs that expire in early November, the stock is hospitalized at the end of October. At the end of October it was packed and prepared to be returned to the Pharmacy Depo.
"At the end of the month, a stock taking is carried out, the schedule of returning to Depo the beginning of the month. In essence, the expired drug that was found will be returned to Depo, not to be distributed again to patients, "he concluded.
